title: Alexander Shulgin
summary: Alexander "Sasha" Theodore Shulgin (June 17, 1925 â€“ June 2, 2014) was an American medicinal chemist, biochemist, organic chemist,  pharmacologist, psychopharmacologist, and author. He is credited with introducing 3,4-methylenedioxymethamphetamine (commonly known as MDMA, "ecstasy", "mandy" and "molly") to psychologists in the late 1970s for psychopharmaceutical use and for the discovery, synthesis and personal bioassay of over 230 psychoactive compounds for their psychedelic and entactogenic potential.
